basics.name: Hugo Arganda
basics.summary: With more than 13 years of experience in automotive and telecommunications, I lead diverse teams and deliver top-notch results. I'm skilled at balancing leadership duties with hands-on technical work.

work.name: Luxoft
summary: Led an Android Automotive QA automation team
Implemented process improvements resulting in a 40% increase in test automation pass rate
Executed process improvements that resulted in a 60% time reduction in automation test cycles
Implemented CI strategy, leading to a 20% increase in team productivity
Technical lead for Python and Ruby scripting
Developed BDD step definitions in Ruby
People manager overseeing team members in the US and MX
Successfully achieved a 30+ member team staffing within a span of 6 months
Collaborated closely with the recruitment team to devise and execute targeted hiring strategies
Managed budgeting and financial aspects related to project delivery

work.name: Luxoft
summary: Led a program to develop an Edge Computing device to assess driving behaviors
Program manager overseeing the product development from POC to SOP
Provisioned Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using AWS CloudFormation
Integrated AWS IoT services like Greengrass, Fleetwise, and IoT Core
Developed AWS Greengrass Components in C++ and Python
Linux Embedded development for NXP S32G (Vehicle Network Processor)
Integrated WiFi and LTE drivers (Quectel) for Linux
Developed CAN communications components (SocketCAN)

work.name: Luxoft
summary: Led the Software development for an Automotive ADAS project (Parking Assistant Module - PAM)
Accountable for the software development process V-cycle (ASPICE SWE and MAN)
Worked in close liaison with Automotive OEMs, Tier 1, and Tier 2 clients
Led a team of 4 project managers, overseeing their projects and promoting best practices
Developed and maintained strong relationships with clients, stakeholders, and team members
Managed a multicultural team across Egypt, India, USA, and Mexico

work.name: Luxoft
summary: New feature development and maintenance of an Automotive Heavy Duty Vehicles ECU reflash tool
Implemented ECU flashing sequences (CAN, J1939, J1850, KWP2000, ISO-9141)
Developed C++ and JavaScript software components
Developed Windows DLLs (using C++) to interface with third-party hardware interfaces (Value-CAN)
Achieved 80% win rate in 6 bids, managed 5 full project lifecycles
Maintained 30% contribution margin, cut lead times by 80%
Conducted technical interviews for C, C++, and Python

work.name: Luxoft
summary: Led the Software development for an Automotive ADAS project (Parking Assistant Module - PAM)
Worked in close liaison with Automotive OEMs, Tier 1, and Tier 2 clients
Led two software development teams, with a maximum headcount of 14 members
Focused on bug fixing and addressing technical debt

work.name: Luxoft
summary: Coded in Embedded C for ADAS ECUs (PAM, IPMB)
Analyzed Functional Safety (ISO 26262) Software Requirements

work.name: Dextra Technologies
summary: Utilized C programming language for ARM uC and adhered to MISRA-C standard
Developed code components within FreeRTOS to manage communication tasks and protocols.
Implemented OTA Firmware update communications manager module (GSM, CDMA)

Software integrator role (git)

summary: Designed and implemented a QA Automation Framework from scratch (using Python, and Go)
Validated GPS functionality, vehicle protocols (CAN, J1939, J1850, KWP2000, ISO-9141), and BLE

work.name: Continental Automotive
summary: Testing for Automotive ADAS ECUs (Airbag Control Unit - ACU, and Seatbelt Reminder - SBR)
Implemented test equipment instrumentation using LabVIEW, and TestExec
Developed test automation scripts in Python

Project Management: CMMI, ASPICE, MS Project, Jira, Confluence, Rally, TeamForge, Tableau
Project life-cycle, V-Model, Leadership, Scrum (Scrum Master, Product Owner)
Cost Control, Time management, Effective communication, Risk assessment

UART, SPI, I2C, BLE, USB HID, HTTP
